botanical_details.genus: Rosa can be deciduous or semi-evergreen shrubs or scrambling climbers, with usually thorny stems bearing compound pinnate leaves and solitary or clustered flowers. Flowers may be followed by showy red or purple fruits in some varieties.
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Shrub roses are large shrubs with usually thorny stems bearing large leaves and fragrant, single to double flowers in clusters in summer, and usually also in autumn

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in full sun in fertile, humus rich, moist but well-drained soil. For best flowering feed with a balanced fertiliser and mulch in late winter or early spring. Feed with a balanced fertiliser again in early summer. See rose cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by hardwood cutings in autumn or by chip budding in summer. Propagate for own use only.
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, rose leafhopper, glasshouse red spider mite, scale insects, caterpillars, large rose sawfly, rose leaf rolling sawfly. Deer and rabbits may cause damage
how_to_grow.diseases: Very, healthy and disease resistant but may be susceptible to rose powdery mildew, rose blackspot or rose rust in dry soils
